channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping in subway, 2nd October
item.description:
Loads of clothes left.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped wheelie bin, 2nd October
item.description:
The bin is full of rubble soil bricks and broken tiles. It was dumped Monday 2/10. It’s so heavy I can’t shift it and it’s obstructing the pavement as it’s adjacent to a street tree. The same man was cctv’d taking a bin from a house opposite me and dumping stuff on Algernon Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Ellerdale Street, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped builders waste, 2nd October
item.description:
Hi. This bag of waste has been dumped and left on street for last 2 weeks by builders working on adjacent site. Please can it be cleared as obstructing pavement and appropriate action taken against builders.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warneford Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches touching lines, 2nd October
item.description:
Hi I did report this problem already this week 8230137. I reported it in the evening of the 29/9/25 and got a reply at 9am in the morning of the 30/9/25 saying status fixed . How is that possible . A complete fob off and zero explanation. Very big branches with phone line running against it and other branches hanging over and touching the phone lines.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Rosebery Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Way, Poverest, London

item.title: Overflowing rubbish, 2nd October
item.description:
An overflowing and broken bin on Fletching road has been spreading rubbish on the street. The problem is made worst by animals creating a health hazard for the whole area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole cover, 2nd October
item.description:
In the inside/bus lane of Plumstead Rd (west bound) prior to the junction of Burrage Rd, the road surface around man hole cover has sunk and the manhole cover is no longer flush. Manhole moves when traffic passes over it and acts as a pothole causing discomfort for vehicular traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Next to number 16 Woodyard in the play area, 2nd October
item.description:
Hi Camden, Name - Taslima Rashid Address - 16 Woodyard Close, NW5 4BX Phone - 07857910788 The problem: we have two trees, planted by Camden that are very close to the side of our house in the play area which is now used as an allotment for residents. We have had an engineer inspect them - they have advised they will likely affect the foundations in due course if not removed, due to the proximity to the house.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Woodyard Close, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping & commercial bin overflowing, 2nd October
item.description:
This is the third time I’ve complained about this commercial bin overflowing with rubbish. It’s a disgrace. It’s attracting vermin. It’s an eyesore. Plus we now have fly tipping. When is this going to be dealt with?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tempory reinstatement in lieu of missing paving flag, 2nd October
item.description:
Temporary reinstatement in lieu of missing paving flag . Temp reinstatement is crumbling and is acting as causing people to skid and fall. A paving flag needs to be cut to the correct size and installed . Side of 1 Blackfen Road, Maple Crescent Easting 546374 Northing 174450
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, London

item.title: Glass and cigarette butts, 2nd October
item.description:
Shattered glass bits on pavement outside the newsagents and charity shop and bottle shop in Pickford lane. Lots of cigarette butts outside Londis aka Browns newsagents. The pavements are s mess. The litter pickers don’t sweep the pavements or pick litter near the charity shop, Lees hairdressers. I’m constantly picking up litter here!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
